public: property bool IsOutgoingMessageFilterEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the outgoing message filter is enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler<Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessageEventArgs> IsSendingMessage;
.event class System.EventHandler`1<class Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessageEventArgs> IsSendingMessage
Public Custom Event IsSendingMessage As EventHandler(Of RoomMessageEventArgs)
public: event EventHandler<Microsoft::Lync::Model::Room::RoomMessageEventArgs ^> ^ IsSendingMessage;

Docs.summary: Raised when the signed in user has finished typing in the group chat room message typing area or Room.BeginSendMessage has been called and Room.IsOutgoingMessageFilterEnabled returns true.

remarks.para: If a user finishes typing a message to be posted to a chat room, your application logic has a chance to review the pending post by catching the IsSendingMessage event and running filter or formatting logic against the message string. If the user's message passes your filter, then post the message to the room by calling SendFilteredMessage with the enumerator RoomMessageFilteringAction.Passed. If the message does not pass your filter, call SendFilteredMessage with the enumerator RoomMessageFilteringAction.Canceled. If the message passes your filter but you reformat the message or replace text, call the method with the RoomMessageFilteringAction.Replaced enumerator.

remarks.para: If the Lync client is signed out after you get an instance of Room, then the Properties property is set to null. You should test Properties for a null state or read the LyncClient.State property before attempting to read Properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SendFilteredMessage (Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessage message, Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessageFilteringAction action);
.method public hidebysig instance void SendFilteredMessage(class Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessage message, valuetype Microsoft.Lync.Model.Room.RoomMessageFilteringAction action) cil managed
Public Sub SendFilteredMessage (message As RoomMessage, action As RoomMessageFilteringAction)
public: void SendFilteredMessage(Microsoft::Lync::Model::Room::RoomMessage ^ message, Microsoft::Lync::Model::Room::RoomMessageFilteringAction action);

Docs.summary: Sends a message that has passed a filter as defined by a custom application.

remarks.para: If a user finishes typing a message to be posted to a chat room, your application logic has a chance to review the pending post by catching the IsSendingMessage event and running filter or formatting logic against the message string. If the user's message passes your filter, then post the message to the room by calling SendFilteredMessage with the enumerator RoomMessageFilteringAction.Passed. If the message does not pass your filter, call SendFilteredMessage with the enumerator RoomMessageFilteringAction.Canceled. If the message passes your filter but you reformat the message or replace text, call the method with the RoomMessageFilteringAction.Replaced enumerator. Note: If you call SendFilteredMessage multiple times with the same message, an exception is raised by Room.EndSendMessage with each send operation after the first send operation.
